added_lines: # turn on all the ceilometer services by default # Pollsters enable_service ceilometer-acompute ceilometer-acentral ceilometer-aipmi # Notification Agent enable_service ceilometer-anotification # Data Collector enable_service ceilometer-collector # API service enable_service ceilometer-api # Alarming enable_service ceilometer-alarm-notifier ceilometer-alarm-evaluator # Default directories CEILOMETER_DIR=$DEST/ceilometer CEILOMETER_CONF_DIR=/etc/ceilometer CEILOMETER_CONF=$CEILOMETER_CONF_DIR/ceilometer.conf CEILOMETER_API_LOG_DIR=/var/log/ceilometer-api CEILOMETER_AUTH_CACHE_DIR=${CEILOMETER_AUTH_CACHE_DIR:-/var/cache/ceilometer} CEILOMETER_WSGI_DIR=${CEILOMETER_WSGI_DIR:-/var/www/ceilometer} # Set up database backend CEILOMETER_BACKEND=${CEILOMETER_BACKEND:-mysql} # Ceilometer connection info. CEILOMETER_SERVICE_PROTOCOL=http CEILOMETER_SERVICE_HOST=$SERVICE_HOST CEILOMETER_SERVICE_PORT=${CEILOMETER_SERVICE_PORT:-8777} CEILOMETER_USE_MOD_WSGI=${CEILOMETER_USE_MOD_WSGI:-${ENABLE_HTTPD_MOD_WSGI_SERVICES}} # To enable OSprofiler change value of this variable to "notifications,profiler" CEILOMETER_NOTIFICATION_TOPICS=${CEILOMETER_NOTIFICATION_TOPICS:-notifications} CEILOMETER_EVENTS=${CEILOMETER_EVENTS:-True} CEILOMETER_COORDINATION_URL=${CEILOMETER_COORDINATION_URL:-} CEILOMETER_PIPELINE_INTERVAL=${CEILOMETER_PIPELINE_INTERVAL:-} # Tell Tempest this project is present TEMPEST_SERVICES+=,ceilometer # Set up default directories for client and middleware GITDIR["python-ceilometerclient"]=$DEST/python-ceilometerclient GITDIR["ceilometermiddleware"]=$DEST/ceilometermiddleware # Get rid of this before done. # Tell emacs to use shell-script-mode ## Local variables: ## mode: shell-script ## End:

commit_message:
Updated default fernet key usage

This change makes the use of fernet tokens production ready. The changes are
as follows:
  * Ensures that the keys are rotated on every playbook execution
  * Removes the need to sync keys back to a deployment host when distributing
    them to other keystone hosts.
  * Creates an autonomous key rotation process that can rotate on the following
    intervals [reboot, yearly, annually, monthly, weekly, daily, hourly] to all
    hosts from any keystone fernet host.
  * Fixes the section in `keystone.conf` which was named "fernet_key" instead
    of "fernet_token".

Change-Id: I50f6a852930728631f5c681a8aa0f1321d7424ac
Related-Bug: #1463569
Closes-Bug: #1468256

commit_message:
Provide work around for 0.0.0.0/0 ::/0 for ipset

Previously, the ipset_manager would pass in 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 if
these addresses were inputted as allowed address pairs. This causes
ipset to raise an error as it does not work with zero prefix sizes.
To solve this problem we use two ipset rules to represent this:

Ipv4: 0.0.0.0/1 and 128.0.0.1/1
IPv6: ::/1' and '8000::/1

All of this logic is handled via _sanitize_addresses() in the ipset_manager
which is called to convert the input.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/ipset_manager.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ipset_manager.py

Change-Id: I8c6a08e0cf3b5b5386fe03af9f2174c666b8ac75
Closes-bug: 1461054
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/194697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import netaddr def _sanitize_addresses(self, addresses): """This method converts any address to ipset format. If an address has a mask of /0 we need to cover to it to a mask of /1 as ipset does not support /0 length addresses. Instead we use two /1's to represent the /0. """ sanitized_addresses = [] for ip in addresses: if (netaddr.IPNetwork(ip).prefixlen == 0): if(netaddr.IPNetwork(ip).version == 4): sanitized_addresses.append('0.0.0.0/1') sanitized_addresses.append('128.0.0.0/1') elif (netaddr.IPNetwork(ip).version == 6): sanitized_addresses.append('::/1') sanitized_addresses.append('8000::/1') else: sanitized_addresses.append(ip) return sanitized_addresses member_ips = self._sanitize_addresses(member_ips)

commit_message:
Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

glance_api_servers is still available and if specified will be used in
favour of host/port, but default it is commented out and the host/port
will be used - which uses the internal_lb_vip_address and default
glance_api_service_port.

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59
Closes-Bug: #1461245
(cherry picked from commit d8b4cf9e790f812b2cfafb237d5909e46c3744d9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/97/195497/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: glance_api_servers: "{{ internal_lb_vip_address }}:{{ glance_service_port }}"
deleted_lines: glance_api_servers: "{% for host in groups['glance_all'] %}{{ hostvars[host]['container_address'] }}:{{ glance_service_port }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}"

subject: Already dead process tolerance in unstack.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 10:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/loadbalancer', 'functions-common', 'lib/swift'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/f750a6fedbb34399e1ee4dd540c13028d53c0e13', 'message': 'Already dead process tolerance in unstack.sh

The gate/updown.sh calls the unstack.sh with
-ex option. Normally we do not use -e with unstack.sh.

The unstack.sh can fail if the service already stopped,
and it also can have flaky failures on the gate.

For example the stop_swift function tries to kill swift in two
different ways, and if the first one succeeds before the 2th attempt
the pkill fails the whole unstack.sh.

This change accepts kill failure.
Normally the kill can fail if the process does not exits,
or when you do not have permission to the kill operation.

Since the permission issue is very unlikely in our case,
this change does not tries to distinguish the two operation.

The behavior of the unstack.sh wen you are not using -ex should
not be changed by this change.

Change-Id: I64bf3cbe1b60c96f5b271dcfb620c3d4b50de26b
'}]
commit_message:
Already dead process tolerance in unstack.sh

The gate/updown.sh calls the unstack.sh with
-ex option. Normally we do not use -e with unstack.sh.

The unstack.sh can fail if the service already stopped,
and it also can have flaky failures on the gate.

For example the stop_swift function tries to kill swift in two
different ways, and if the first one succeeds before the 2th attempt
the pkill fails the whole unstack.sh.

This change accepts kill failure.
Normally the kill can fail if the process does not exits,
or when you do not have permission to the kill operation.

Since the permission issue is very unlikely in our case,
this change does not tries to distinguish the two operation.

The behavior of the unstack.sh wen you are not using -ex should
not be changed by this change.

Change-Id: I64bf3cbe1b60c96f5b271dcfb620c3d4b50de26b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/06/197506/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pkill -f swift- || true

subject: Handle errors during glance image updates correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 11:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/glance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1e84c93dc8e611ddebebff24bd782a802f000e6f', 'message': 'Handle errors during glance image updates correctly

Before an UnboundLocalError would occur in case an error would happen
during image updates, because of incorrect referencing of a variable.
Moreover the error was muted by exceptions.handle with ignore=True,
and could result in an incorrect success message.
This change removes references to unused image variable and allows
exceptions to be handled by the function, that calls image_update.

Change-Id: I35ea98a146690565582dd9beea62941f97d32474
Closes-Bug: #1464991
(cherry picked from commit 7eb4e3595c5a30f95d976ea84493453730f3c806)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle errors during glance image updates correctly

Before an UnboundLocalError would occur in case an error would happen
during image updates, because of incorrect referencing of a variable.
Moreover the error was muted by exceptions.handle with ignore=True,
and could result in an incorrect success message.
This change removes references to unused image variable and allows
exceptions to be handled by the function, that calls image_update.

Change-Id: I35ea98a146690565582dd9beea62941f97d32474
Closes-Bug: #1464991
(cherry picked from commit 7eb4e3595c5a30f95d976ea84493453730f3c806)

deleted_lines: from horizon import exceptions image = glanceclient(request).images.update(image_id, **kwargs) except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, ignore=True) return image

commit_message:
Improve doc strings after changing method for index creation

After replacing ensure_index for create_index in impl_mongodb and impl_db2
doc strings and comments were not changed. This patch improves it.

Change-Id: I21022a054dd9c85a15111efe1723e5437ac60022

commit_message:
remove non RabbitMQ messaging

Part of what was decided at summit is devstack needs to return to a
more opinionated stance, the following removes support for non
RabbitMQ messaging. RabbitMQ is used by over 95% of our community
(statistically all of it), so it's a pretty clear line to draw that
this shouldn't be in tree.

iniset_rpc_backend will be our stable hook for other projects that
want to implement this out of tree. The burden on creating those out
of tree plugins will be on those that wish to support those
alternative stacks.

Change-Id: I8073a895c03ec927a2598eff6c2f01e5c82606fc

commit_message:
Convert RT compute_node to be a ComputeNode object

This patch converts the ResourceTracker compute_node property
to be a ComputeNode object. A number of fields automatically
take care of mapping their values to a db format, so some of the
code creating json strings goes away with this change.

The scheduler client report code is simplified by the change
to use a ComputeNode object.

Note that this change naturally required modification to a
number of tests in test_tracker, test_resource_tracker and
test_client to cater for objects instead of dicts. Some of these
tests were using incorrect values or arbitrary key names that do
not exist as ComputeNode fields, so they had to be corrected to
conform to the type checking of the ComputeNode object.

part of blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I2279f01ad55083c31c663242a2a60a48191e88c3

added_lines: from nova.objects import pci_device_pool as pci_dpl_obj # old_resources is held as a primitive self._copy_resources(resources) self._copy_resources(resources) self.compute_node = objects.ComputeNode(context) self._copy_resources(resources) self.compute_node.service_id = service['id'] self.compute_node.host = self.host self.compute_node.create() pci_dpl = pci_dpl_obj.from_pci_stats(self.pci_tracker.stats) self.compute_node.pci_device_pool = pci_dpl else: self.compute_node.pci_device_pool = None # NOTE(pmurray): metrics should not be a json string in ComputeNode, # but it is. This should be changed in ComputeNode self.compute_node.metrics = jsonutils.dumps(metrics) return objects.ComputeNode.get_by_host_and_nodename( """Check to see if any resources have changed.""" resources_prim = resources.obj_to_primitive() if cmp(resources_prim, self.old_resources) != 0: self.old_resources = resources_prim else: resources.obj_reset_changes() return False self.scheduler_client.update_resource_stats( context, (self.host, self.nodename), values) pci_dpl = pci_dpl_obj.from_pci_stats(self.pci_filter.stats) resources.pci_dev_pools = pci_dpl else: resources.pci_dev_pools = None pci_dpl = pci_dpl_obj.from_pci_stats(self.pci_tracker.stats) resources.pci_dev_pools = pci_dpl else: resources.pci_dev_pools = None def _copy_resources(self, resources): """Copy hypervisor resource data into compute_node.""" # NOTE(pmurray): the presence of some of these fields is checked # in _verify_resources() keys = ["vcpus", "memory_mb", "local_gb", "cpu_info", "vcpus_used", "memory_mb_used", "local_gb_used", "numa_topology", "hypervisor_type", "hypervisor_version", "hypervisor_hostname", "disk_available_least", "stats"] for key in keys: if key in resources: self.compute_node[key] = resources[key] # supported_instances has a different name in compute_node if 'supported_instances' in resources: self.compute_node.supported_hv_specs = ( resources['supported_instances'])
deleted_lines: import copy cn = {} cn.update(resources) cn['service_id'] = service['id'] cn['host'] = self.host # initialize load stats from existing instances: self._write_ext_resources(cn) # NOTE(pmurray): the stats field is stored as a json string. The # json conversion will be done automatically by the ComputeNode object # so this can be removed when using ComputeNode. cn['stats'] = jsonutils.dumps(cn['stats']) # pci_passthrough_devices may be in resources but are not # stored in compute nodes cn.pop('pci_passthrough_devices', None) self.compute_node = self.conductor_api.compute_node_create(context, cn) # NOTE(sbauza): We don't want to miss the first creation event self._update_resource_stats(context, cn) # now copy resources to compute node self.compute_node.update(resources) self.compute_node['pci_stats'] = jsonutils.dumps( self.pci_tracker.stats) else: self.compute_node['pci_stats'] = jsonutils.dumps([]) self.compute_node['metrics'] = jsonutils.dumps(metrics) compute = objects.ComputeNode.get_by_host_and_nodename( return obj_base.obj_to_primitive(compute) """Check to see if any resouces have changed.""" if cmp(resources, self.old_resources) != 0: self.old_resources = copy.deepcopy(resources) return False # NOTE(pmurray): the stats field is stored as a json string. The # json conversion will be done automatically by the ComputeNode object # so this can be removed when using ComputeNode. values['stats'] = jsonutils.dumps(values['stats']) self._update_resource_stats(context, values) def _update_resource_stats(self, context, values): stats = values.copy() stats['id'] = self.compute_node['id'] self.scheduler_client.update_resource_stats( context, (self.host, self.nodename), stats) resources['pci_stats'] = jsonutils.dumps( self.pci_tracker.stats) else: resources['pci_stats'] = jsonutils.dumps([]) resources['pci_stats'] = jsonutils.dumps(self.pci_tracker.stats) else: resources['pci_stats'] = jsonutils.dumps([])

subject: Fix failing unit tests under py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-11 21:55:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/7d82c4c2358e503d6acd1d7a7d62993feeb5d639', 'message': 'Fix failing unit tests under py34

When running the unit tests on Fedora 21 under py34, several of them
fail with "TypeError: 'xxx' object is not iterable".  This is due to a
bug in mock: http://bugs.python.org/issue23661.

The workaround to this bug is to make side effects that are exceptions
iterable.  This change makes the unit tests work on both py27 and py34.

Change-Id: I4bcda02bb5756fea2a8daecc238ef7439ad43700
Closes-Bug: #1463867

commit_message:
Fix failing unit tests under py34

When running the unit tests under Python >= 3.4.2, several of them
fail with "TypeError: 'xxx' object is not iterable".  This is due to a
bug in mock: http://bugs.python.org/issue23661.

The workaround to this bug is to make side effects that are exceptions
iterable.  This change makes the unit tests work on both py27 and py34.

Change-Id: I4bcda02bb5756fea2a8daecc238ef7439ad43700
Partial-Bug: #1463867

commit_message:
l3 agent: do router cleanup for unknown routers

The patch adds cleanup on router delete for routers which
are unknown to agent. This should cover the case when router is
deleted during resync on agent init.

Functional tests were updated and now handle 3 cases for l3 sync:
 - no routers were deleted during agent downtime,
 - some routers were deleted during agent downtime
 - some routers were deleted during agent resync

Closes-Bug: #1464238
Change-Id: Id98111849fa88d6807f757864187b059c491aaac

commit_message:
Document only exectuables in phase dirs policy

Having data files in the phase subdirs is an easy source of confusion
in reviews (especially when the data file is a script) and theres really
no reason to be putting data files there at this point. Lets make a
convention out of not doing this.

Change-Id: I99571a2a49e14e8c709af20f6d13d662ac745eb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/92/192292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update pbr version to match global requirements

The version of pbr we were using was having trouble parsing a new version
identifier for python-qpid, We have the pbr version hardcoded in many
places so update it to match whats currently in global-requirements.

Fixes bug #1470871
Change-Id: Ia5aec472555ad1368684b224a55c29242ae40b58

commit_message:
Block subtractive operations in migrations for Kilo and beyond

In Kilo, we made a point to not allow any subtractive DB migrations. That
gave us a lot of flexibility for upgrades from Juno. Reviewers did the
awesome job of keeping to that plan. However, we need a mechanical filter
to prevent regressions. This adds that in the form of a banned-ops fixture
in test_migrations.

It excludes migrations from pre-Kilo times, as well as excludes a few
migrations that are already in place and do reaspnable things.
In general, we need to be extremely careful about letting migrations
put themselves on the exclusion list, so I added scary words around it.

Change-Id: Iefe678d0aeb1ad898fc5a0cee10fd55ccb7e06db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/49/197349/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BannedDBSchemaOperations(fixtures.Fixture): """Ban some operations for migrations""" @staticmethod def _explode(op): raise Exception( 'Operation %s.drop() is not allowed in a database migration' % op) def setUp(self): super(BannedDBSchemaOperations, self).setUp() drop_banned = ['Table', 'Column'] for thing in drop_banned: self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'sqlalchemy.%s.drop' % thing, lambda *a, **k: self._explode(thing)))

commit_message:
Update requirements

- current global requirements
- merge py3 req files into markers

The one eww moment is the -e line for glance store, which only got in
because the infra check-requirements job wasn't checking -py3 files at
all until recently.

Change-Id: I748e9e1bb698085a19c5d8d6060f4d377695dc89

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # # Ensure the given milestone exists on Launchpad # # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from __future__ import print_function from __future__ import unicode_literals import argparse import os import re import subprocess import sys from launchpadlib.launchpad import Launchpad import requests def abort(code, errmsg): print(errmsg, file=sys.stderr) sys.exit(code) # Argument parsing parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Create milestones on LP') parser.add_argument('project', help='launchpad project name') parser.add_argument('repo', help='repository directory') args = parser.parse_args() # Connect to LP print("connecting to launchpad") try: launchpad = Launchpad.login_with('openstack-releasing', 'production') except Exception, error: abort(2, 'Could not connect to Launchpad: ' + str(error)) # Retrieve project try: project = launchpad.projects[args.project] except KeyError: abort(2, ' Could not find project: %s' % args.project) series_data = {} BASE_URL = 'http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/%s/tag/?id=%s' PATTERN = re.compile(r'tag name[^(]*\(([^)]*)\)', re.MULTILINE) # tag name2014.1.5 (44bb894f36c58ba51b6cc64763209f4c97f89206) # noqa os.chdir(args.repo) dev_null = open('/dev/null', 'w') for series in project.series: for milestone in series.all_milestones: # url = BASE_URL % (args.project, milestone.name) # tag_req = requests.get(url) # match = PATTERN.search(tag_req.text) # if match is None: # print('did not find milestone %s tagged for %s' % # (milestone.name, args.project)) # continue # sha = match.groups()[0] try: show_output = subprocess.check_output([ 'git', 'show', '--no-patch', '--pretty=%H', milestone.name, ], stderr=dev_null) sha = show_output.rstrip().splitlines()[-1] except subprocess.CalledProcessError: print('did not find milestone %s tagged for %s' % (milestone.name, args.project)) continue series_data.setdefault(series.name, []).append((milestone.name, sha)) for series, milestones in sorted(series_data.items()): # print(series, milestones) print('# %s' % series) print('---') for milestone, sha in milestones: print('- version: %s' % milestone) print(' projects:') print(' - repo: openstack/%s' % args.project) print(' launchpad: %s' % args.project) print(' hash: %s' % sha) print()

commit_message:
Cleanup the specs repo

This commit bakes several cleanups into one patch. First it clearly
separates devstack and tempest specs by creating a separate tempest
subdir for specs. The next step is moving all implemented specs/bps
into the implemented dir to indicate this. The last is deleting specs
which were outdated and never implemented.

Change-Id: I86331ac279b6a9cdb94ed4c43e5b0c41697e6a7d

commit_message:
Replace xrange() with six.moves.range()

Patch generated by the xrange operation of the sixer tool:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Manual changes:

* Fix indentation for pep8 checks
* Fix TestGreenthreadSafeIterator.test_access_is_serialized of
  test.unit.common.test_utils:
  replace range(1, 11) with list(range(1, 11))
* Fix UnsafeXrange docstring, revert change

Change-Id: Icb7e26135c5e57b5302b8bfe066b33cafe69fe4d

subject: Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 21:02:29.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile', 'spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate/commit/624d58dec6c91cf0b5bbc14f10cf40d4f792ae03', 'message': "Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: If77faa655f1831a7c9ad2c8d5c42ea712a4b651d
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: If77faa655f1831a7c9ad2c8d5c42ea712a4b651d
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/19/197319/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 21:03:04.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile', 'spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon/commit/ee92a781ecd167269494647596f3c8510d831868', 'message': "Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: Id9c974e53cf29561ba4e94df5b82efff24293ad0
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: Id9c974e53cf29561ba4e94df5b82efff24293ad0
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/22/197322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'beaker/puppet_install_helper' run_puppet_install_helper
deleted_lines: hosts.each do |host| install_puppet on host, "mkdir -p #{host['distmoduledir']}" end

subject: Theming Mechanism now supports 3rd party themes

The 'material' theme gives an example of how to make use of a 3rd party theme
using the theming functionality.  In addition to incorporating a theme,
loaded as a static asset using requirements.txt, it also gives examples of how
to cleanly override styles, variables, icon fonts and Django templates.

commit_message:
Theming Mechanism now supports 3rd party themes

In order to fascilate the bulk of the CSS Reorg effort, it will be extremely
beneficial to quickly toggle between many different themes in order to validate
proper cascading inheritance.  This work prompted the following example theme.

The 'material' theme gives an example of how to make use of a 3rd party theme
using the theming functionality.  In addition to incorporating a theme,
loaded as a static asset using requirements.txt, it also gives examples of how
to cleanly override styles, variables, icon fonts and Django templates.

Change-Id: I00bbf11e72ad8aa8d2c43f0a76556e047c6cf1fa
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/95/198095/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Usage docs

Nobody could use the library because there weren't docs that told
them how to use it. Adds some overall usage docs

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache refs/changes/01/197701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Caching Layer Implementation. When this library is imported, it registers the following backends in :mod:`dogpile.cache`: * ``oslo_cache.noop`` - :class:`oslo_cache.backends.noop.NoopCacheBackend` * ``oslo_cache.mongo`` - :class:`oslo_cache.backends.mongo.MongoCacheBackend` * ``oslo_cache.memcache_pool`` - :class:`oslo_cache.backends.memcache_pool.PooledMemcachedBackend` To use this library: Inside your application code, decorate the methods that you want the results to be cached with a memoization decorator created with :func:`get_memoization_decorator`. This function takes a group name from the config. Register [`section`] ``caching`` and [`section`] ``cache_time`` options for the sections that your decorators use so that caching can be configured. This library's configuration options must be registered in your application's :class:`oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts` instance. Do this by passing the ConfigOpts instance to :func:`configure`. """ name='oslo_cache.noop', modulepath='oslo_cache.backends.noop', objname='NoopCacheBackend') name='oslo_cache.mongo', modulepath='oslo_cache.backends.mongo', objname='MongoCacheBackend') name='oslo_cache.memcache_pool', modulepath='oslo_cache.backends.memcache_pool', objname='PooledMemcachedBackend') """Build a function based on the `cache_on_arguments` decorator. The memoization decorator that gets created by this function is a :meth:`dogpile.cache.region.CacheRegion.cache_on_arguments` decorator, where * The ``should_cache_fn`` is set to a function that returns True if both the ``[cache] enabled`` option is true and [`section`] ``caching`` is True. * The ``expiration_time`` is set from the [`expiration_section`] ``cache_time`` option if ``expiration_section`` is passed in and the value is set, or [`section`] ``cache_time`` if ``expiration_section`` is not passed in and the value is set, or ``[cache] expiration_time`` otherwise.
deleted_lines: """Caching Layer Implementation.""" 'oslo_cache.noop', 'oslo_cache.backends.noop', 'NoopCacheBackend') 'oslo_cache.mongo', 'oslo_cache.backends.mongo', 'MongoCacheBackend') 'oslo_cache.memcache_pool', 'oslo_cache.backends.memcache_pool', 'PooledMemcachedBackend') """Build a function based on the `_on_arguments` decorator for the section. For any given object that has caching capabilities, a pair of functions is required to properly determine the status of the caching capabilities (a toggle to indicate caching is enabled and any override of the default TTL for cached data). This function will return an object that has the memoization decorator ``_on_arguments`` pre-configured for the driver.

subject: Remove 'shared' from Neutron Firewall table
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 12:12:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/fwaas_tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/neutron_data.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/991d8ac86c12fa45e1275851711d6feb2d9891a2', 'message': "Remove 'shared' from Neutron Firewall table

Neutron FWaaS firewall object does not support 'shared' attribute
at now and 'shared' attribute is not included in API response.
This commmit removes 'shared' attribute for firewall object.
For more detail of the background, please see the bug report.

Note that 'shared' attributes for firewall rule and policy
are supported. This commit only affect the firewall object.

Change-Id: I5787529395e0005ce1efee48beb6f0f688c1c736
Closes-Bug: #1465440
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'shared' from Neutron Firewall table

Neutron FWaaS firewall object does not support 'shared' attribute
at now and 'shared' attribute is not included in API response.
This commmit removes 'shared' attribute for firewall object.
For more detail of the background, please see the bug report.

Note that 'shared' attributes for firewall rule and policy
are supported. This commit only affect the firewall object.

Change-Id: I5787529395e0005ce1efee48beb6f0f688c1c736
Closes-Bug: #1465440
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/21/194621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The projects page is based on tnovacik's regions patches.
Add tests for create, delete project.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

commit_message:
Fix date pickers in metering modal

The metering forms were using the date picker functionality from the
d3 line chart library, this used to work when it was loaded as a whole
page as the d3 libary would run intending to setup any d3 graphs however
now it is being loaded as a modal the elements that would be affected by
the d3 code do not exist at page load time.

In order to get the date picker events to be added to the elements on
the form when the modal loads, the JS in the forms template has been
extended in this patch to support adding those events.

This patch also changes the data attributes on the form elements so that
they do not conflict with any d3 line chart elements.

Alongside the javascript this patch fixes bug to do with parsing the
dates in metering utils and adds UTs to prevent regression.

Change-Id: I4e239daa03b2f54e434254bac48ba0cceb037b5d
Closes-Bug: 1427756
(cherry picked from commit 0d010f601cecacac01c26be572ae0d6444df9669)

this patch refactors the Angular code for 'Security Groups' step
in Launch Instance wizard.

commit_message:
libvirt: Fail when live block migrating instance with volumes

This raises an exception when attempting to live block migrate (nova
live-migration --block-migrate) an instance with attached volumes.
libvirt copies these volumes from themselves to themselves. At a
minimum, this is horribly slow and de-sparses a sparse volume; at
worst, this could cause massive data corruption.

(cherry picked from commit d667b6a63e80b2f8d6311c2cf224ba32628eed84)

Closes-Bug: 1398999
Change-Id: Ibcd423976bb9fea46e3e1cb23cc8e5cd944d8fc2

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # How many seconds to wait for the API to be responding before giving up API_RESPONDING_TIMEOUT=20 if ! timeout ${API_RESPONDING_TIMEOUT} sh -c "while ! curl -s http://127.0.0.1:9001/ 2>/dev/null | grep -q 'v1' ; do sleep 1; done"; then echo "The Searchlight API failed to respond within ${API_RESPONDING_TIMEOUT} seconds" exit 1 fi echo "Successfully contacted the Searchlight API" # Where Searchlight and Tempest code lives SEARCHLIGHT_DIR=${SEARCHLIGHT_DIR:-/opt/stack/new/searchlight} TEMPEST_DIR=${TEMPEST_DIR:-/opt/stack/new/tempest} # Install tempest pip install -e $TEMPEST_DIR export TEMPEST_CONFIG=$TEMPEST_DIR/etc/tempest.conf pushd $SEARCHLIGHT_DIR/functionaltests # run the tests in parallel testr init testr run --parallel --subunit | subunit-trace --no-failure-debug -f retval=$? testr slowest popd exit $retval

commit_message:
Move Sahara into in-tree plugin

Once the Sahara related code moved to Sahara repo and used, we can
remove Sahara specific code from Devstack.

commit_message:
Remove sourcing of lib/sahara

We're going to move Devstack code to the Sahara repo and Grenade
support will be done as a in-tree plugin as well.
Currently this sourcing is just a no-op.

Partial-Implements: bp sahara-devstack-intree

Change-Id: I07c3fede473030e8a110cbf5a08309f890905abf

commit_message:
tooz 0.16.0 or better required

Ceilometer, Cinder and Nova using redis backend
require tooz>=0.16.0 to work properly.

blueprint tooz-for-service-groups

commit_message:
Swap a '*.' with a '.*' in the /etc/hosts grep

It looks like this was supposed to be '.*' from the beginning,
though its worth noting that this would work - albeit accidentally -
if the 127.0.0.1 line were followed by precisely one space or one tab
before the inventory hostname.

Change-Id: I0d6596d8d1e6c0ba361429b3980c416fbd0961d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/13/198013/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command: grep -i "127.0.0.1.*{{ ansible_hostname }}\ localhost" /etc/hosts

commit_message:
Add new VIF type VIF_TYPE_TAP

This change adds a new VIF type, VIF_TYPE_TAP, whose meaning is that
the host side of a vNIC to/from a VM is - at least initially - a
simple TAP interface that is not plugged into a bridge or vSwitch.  A
Neutron agent running on the compute host may subsequently set up
routing or bridging for that TAP interface.

VIF_TYPE_TAP supports a 'mac_address' key, in the VIF details dict,
which allows Neutron to specify the MAC address for the host end of
the TAP interface.

VIF_TYPE_TAP also respect's nova.conf's network_device_mtu setting,
i.e. it sets this value as the TAP interface's MTU.

Change-Id: Ifd63faaa1ef4e085d9baa640c17da856e0960992
Implements: blueprint vif-type-tap

added_lines: vif_tap = network_model.VIF(id='vif-xxx-yyy-zzz', address='ca:fe:de:ad:be:ef', type=network_model.VIF_TYPE_TAP, devname='tap-xxx-yyy-zzz') def test_tap_ethernet_vif_driver(self): d = vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver() br_want = self.vif_tap['devname'] xml = self._get_instance_xml(d, self.vif_tap) node = self._get_node(xml) self._assertTypeAndMacEquals(node, "ethernet", "target", "dev", self.vif_tap, br_want)

commit_message:
Mark required packages before cleanup

Mark required packages before purging and autoremove'ing for cleanup.

* python-minimal - For /usr/bin/python
* python-setuptools - For required setuptools module

Change-Id: Ibe5cbe9090041db2d158cfccee82c66dcfe3fb2f
Closes-Bug: #1470199

subject: Backport "tie minion registration to kubelet activation"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-17 10:28:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/0edcd071c356f09334f56ea7c00308985af9b66f', 'message': 'Backport "tie minion registration to kubelet activation"

this changes moves minion registration out of the
configure-kubernetes-minion.sh script and puts it in a systemd service
unit that tracks the state of the kubelet.service and
registers/unregisters the minion as appropriate.

If scaling down an autoscaling group permitted an instance to shut down
gracefully this would take care of unregistering minions in response to
down scaling operations, but it doesn't, so this can't.

commit_message:
Backport "tie minion registration to kubelet activation"

this changes moves minion registration out of the
configure-kubernetes-minion.sh script and puts it in a systemd service
unit that tracks the state of the kubelet.service and
registers/unregisters the minion as appropriate.

heat-coe-templates: I6532a9bc08bbb2351a2ae5d29bc884cb3cad3508

Change-Id: I2d6a722d63b2b465e880daff87b8307132f82a32

See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function(){ 'use strict'; describe('Identity users idusersEnable factory', function() { var action, api; var fakeAPI = { success: function(){ return this; }, error: function(){ return this; } }; beforeEach(module('hz')); beforeEach(module('hz.dashboard')); beforeEach(module('hz.dashboard.identity.users')); beforeEach(inject(function($injector){ // mock the keystone editUser api // return the same user back api = $injector.get('keystoneAPI'); spyOn(api, 'editUser').and.callFake(function(){ return fakeAPI; }); var idusersEnable = $injector.get('idusersEnable'); action = new idusersEnable(null); spyOn(action, 'toggle').and.callThrough(); })); it('should invoke the keystone editUser api on toggle', function() { var user = { enabled: true }; action.toggle(user); expect(action.toggle).toHaveBeenCalledWith(user); expect(api.editUser).toHaveBeenCalledWith({ enabled: false }); }); }); })();

commit_message:
Ensure location header urls account for script_name

The API is at /v1... but if is mounted at /gnocchi/v1 then
"/gnocchi" is the script_name and we need to account for that when
generatin URLs for location headers.

Pecan already does this where the application_url attribute is being
used (for generating informational urls in response bodies).

A new gabbi test suite is added which runs all of the existing gabbi
tests with a prefix. Getting this to work identified a bug in gabbi,
thus the update to test-requirements.

Change-Id: I6e3b461610ad1b694e6ae3df33831b3f6224668f

commit_message:
constraints file support for devstack.

Constraints files allow a global view of dependencies for devstack
without the side effect that requirements files have of installing
everything everytime. This is part of the cross project
requirements-management spec.

Change-Id: If089d30146629e6cf817edd634e5c2b80f1366dd

commit_message:
Add devstack external plugin spec

Change-Id: I173dee3d57967b1d2ffd30e4868a2832aeac97ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/54/137054/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ========================= Devstack external plugins ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/devstack-external-plugins Support external plugins for devstack. Problem description =================== Devstack has a pretty strong plugin support, you just have to drop your extra feature in the extras.d/ directory and it will automatically parse the file and install the feature as long you have enabled it in your local.conf. This all works very well but that's not very flexible for projects that are not able to be integrated directly in devstack core. Currently an external OpenStack project who wants to tell its users how to test a feature has to explain how to download a file to put in the `extras.d` directory and enabling it. As for integrated projects they may wants to take care of how they do devstack directly in their own repo and get devstack to use that instead of having to request for a change in devstack repository. Proposed change =============== We could have devstack patched to support a syntax like this for enable_service :: enable_service=external_feature:http://git.openstack.org/external_feature ..note:: This syntax can be extended like pip's `requirements.txt`_ to checkout a specific commit or branch/tag. When specified devstack would then checkout that directory in `${DEST}` and look for a `devstack/` directory in there. If it find a file called `plugin.sh` there he would use it the same way he uses the plugins in the `extras.d` and thus have the numbering working there as well. If there is a file `post-install.sh` he would execute it at the same step he would execute the `local.sh` in the main stack.sh .. _requirements.txt: http://pip.readthedocs.org/en/1.0.1/requirement-format.html#git Alternatives ------------ The alternative would be to stay as the status quo like we have now and have them to curl the extras file from the external repository and place it in the `extras.d` directory. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: * Chmouel Boudjnah <chmouel@chmouel.com> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-2 Work Items ---------- * Add support in devstack. * Get an example repositor setup. * Get a project like nova-docker to use it.

commit_message:
Redefine CIFS export_location path from '/' to '\'

For Windows users, the export_location is using '\' but manila
export_location using '/'. So redefine the CIFS export_location for
windows user is more affinity.

Change-Id: I11533ddfa3bd7d4f0690091636db6b3e8a67d7dc
Signed-off-by: Ketor <d.ketor@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/50/197450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if share_dict['export_location'] and share_dict['export_location'].startswith('//'): share_dict['export_location'] = share_dict['export_location'].replace('/', '\\')

commit_message:
Disable router advertisements on bridge devices

In a multi-node Neutron DVR configuration, nova was automatically
configuring the qbr bridge with an IPv6 address. There is no need for
this to occur, as the bridge is only used by the Neutron security group
code.

Change-Id: I4eab9d7b2839d99ec603800f04c1913002de63da

commit_message:
Merge deployments data for collectors heat, request

This is required so that a swift-enabled TripleO undercloud can switch
to polling for metadata from a TempURL rather than heat.

Change-Id: I73ac9e01f85e0c72ce7411e2c61c545322f3dccc
Closes-Bug: #1424913

commit_message:
Enhance run-tox.sh to support functional testing

This change enhances the run-tox.sh script to support invoking tox as
another user and skipping the check for sudo usage, both of which
support rootwrap testing in functional jobs.  This change also adds an
option to move logs to /opt/stack/logs, which is also useful for
functional jobs.

Change-Id: Ia69f0bef031b33265d508e6a47cc8fb294cb4830
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/56/161456/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -z "$venv" ]] && [[ "$#" -lt 1 ]]; then >&2 echo "Usage: $0 VENV [-u user] [-s] [-m] VENV: The tox environment to run (eg 'python27') -u user The user to run tox as -s Skip check of sudo usage -m Move test artifacts to /opt/stack/logs" exit 1sudo_user= check_sudo=1 move_testr_artifacts=0 # Skip the first (mandatory) argument OPTIND=2 while getopts ":u:s" opt; do case $opt in u) sudo_user=$OPTARG ;; s) check_sudo=0 ;; m) move_testr_artifacts=1 ;; \?) echo "Invalid option: -$OPTARG" >&2 ;; esac done # Ensure that the test results can be processed even if tox was # invoked by another user. if [ -n "$sudo_user" ]; then sudo chmod o+rw . sudo chmod o+rw -R .testrepository fi if [ "$move_testr_artifacts" == "1" ]; then sudo mv ./*.gz /opt/stack/logs/ fi if [ -n "$sudo_user" ]; then sudo_cmd="sudo -H -u $sudo_user" # Ensure the sudo user has ownership over the path sudo chown -R $sudo_user ./ else sudo_cmd= fi $sudo_cmd tox -v -e$venvif [ "$check_sudo" == "1" ]; then check_sudo_usage fi
deleted_lines: # # Usage: run-tox.sh VENV # # Where VENV is the name of the tox environment to run (specified in the # project's tox.ini file).if [[ -z "$venv" ]]; then echo "Usage: $?" echo echo "VENV: The tox environment to run (eg 'python27')" exit 1tox -v -e$venvcheck_sudo_usage

commit_message:
Headers module missing from enabled list

Our openstack-dashboard sites config is using the Headers directive
to prevent html caching by default for security.  Need to make sure
this module is always enabled under apache.

Change-Id: I6f204f194a80b58e608a0a04afc19442d0444598
Related-Bug: #1446701

commit_message:
Graduate fileutils to oslo.utils and oslo.policy

Create a specification for graduating fileutils and it's tests to
oslo.utils and oslo.policy.

Change-Id: I52424202285c28c672651cb6f17256f6aa609b58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/85/170685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, build the docs using tox, or see: http://rst.ninjs.org The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Wrap text at 79 columns. Do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None If you would like to provide a diagram with your spec, ascii diagrams are required. http://asciiflow.com/ is a very nice tool to assist with making ascii diagrams. The reason for this is that the tool used to review specs is based purely on plain text. Plain text will allow review to proceed without having to look at additional files which can not be viewed in gerrit. It will also allow inline feedback on the diagram itself. ==================== Graduating oslo.io ==================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/graduate-oslo-io move the fileutils code (and associated tests) into a library. Library Name ============ oslo.io Contents ======== * openstack/common/fileutils.py * tests/unit/test_fileutils.py Early Adopters ============== * keystone * oslo.policy * oslo.concurrency Public API ========== The public API will be fairly simple. As with the oslo.serialization library, the proposed library (oslo.io) will initially have only helper functions. There are no classes or private functions. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Steve Martinelli (stevemar) Primary Maintainer ------------------ Primary Maintainer: Steve Martinelli (stevemar) Security Contact ---------------- Security Contact: Doug Hellmann (doug-hellmann) Milestones ---------- Liberty-1 Work Items ---------- * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/CreatingANewLibrary#Checklist * public repository available: https://github.com/stevemart/oslo.io Adoption Notes ============== Projects currently importing:: from openstack.common import fileutils would have to switch to importing:: from oslo_io import fileutils Dependencies ============ None References ========== * https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kilo-oslo-library-proposals * Discussion when attempting to add this to oslo.utils: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/154975/ .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Refactor merging out of cfn collector

This is a pure refactoring change which moves the os-apply-config
deployment data merging into its own module. This will allow
other collectors (request, heat) to do the same merging.

Partial-Bug: #1424913
Change-Id: Ic78a60e3efebadbb06ebfd262ceb275ca519a3f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-collect-config refs/changes/55/183355/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from os_collect_config import merger final_list = merger.merged_list_from_content( final_content, cfg.CONF.cfn.deployment_key, name)
deleted_lines: final_list = [] for depkey in cfg.CONF.cfn.deployment_key: if depkey in final_content: deployments = final_content[depkey] if not isinstance(deployments, list): logger.warn( 'Deployment-key %s was found but does not contain a ' 'list.' % (depkey,)) continue logger.debug( 'Deployment found for %s' % (depkey,)) for deployment in deployments: if 'name' not in deployment: logger.warn( 'No name found for a deployment under %s.' % (depkey,)) continue if deployment.get('group', 'Heat::Ungrouped') in ( 'os-apply-config', 'Heat::Ungrouped'): final_list.append((deployment['name'], deployment['config'])) final_list.insert(0, ('cfn', final_content))

commit_message:
Get rid of duplicated creation of security groups in test_volume_boot_pattern

It turns out that a security group in test test_volume_boot_pattern
is created twice. The first security group is created in test itself,
the second security group is created in the method _boot_instance_from_
volume(). This patch fixes it. Now the security group is created once.

Change-Id: I99ec28a70591b346e2ea00c6e16af4e856721aa3

commit_message:
Updated the clone process to exclude unneeded files

This commit changes the clone process to properly exclude files from the repo
clone play/task. This also ensures that when this play is used that all local
repos are an exact match to what is upstream.

Change-Id: I840997d6778f40a9007bce18df792c6b0c69c5eb
Closes-Bug: #1468567
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/99/195399/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rsync -avzlHAX --delete \ {{ mirror_excludes }} \ default_mirror_excludes: - "repos" - "mirror" - "rpcgit" - "openstackgit" - "python_packages" mirror_excludes: "{% for i in repo_mirror_excludes|default(default_mirror_excludes) %} --exclude={{ i }} {% endfor %}"
deleted_lines: rsync -avzlHAX \ --exclude="{{ mirror_excludes }}" \ mirror_excludes: "{{ repo_mirror_excludes|default('repos/* mirror/* rpcgit/* openstackgit/*') }}"

commit_message:
Updated from global requiements and updated .gitreview

- Update for dependencies from global-requirements
- Updated .gitreview for using openstack/ namespace instead of stackforge
- Add ignore H104,E111,E113,H236,H238,E265,H405 haking rules
- Fixed PEP8 errors

Change-Id: Iea3420e93374972d8672537c65dfcf9f7a763478
Closes-Bug: #1469172
Depends-On: I7624cba86c7d5612ac32c14e36fb2d020b599e1c

commit_message:
Make appropriate branch default and updated from global requirements

- Use default value of _BRANCH parameters 'stable/juno' for
  stable/juno release
- Update from global requirements
- Fix lib for using python-muranoclient from stable/juno and openstack
  namespace
- Update .gitreview for using openstack namespace
- Install test-requirements in post_test_hook.sh
- Remove CLI tests
- Update API tests because of tempest updates
- Fix for PEP8 checks after hacking version bump
- Add ignore H233,H405,H904 hacking rules

Change-Id: I7624cba86c7d5612ac32c14e36fb2d020b599e1c
Closes-Bug: #1468746
Closes-Bug: #1469181

libvirt: update VIF metadata with queues in the neutron api

Update VIF metadata with the number of requested queues, when
allocating network resources for instance, in neutron API.

Partially implements blueprint libvirt-virtio-net-multiqueue
Change-Id: I10310bb91e94fc08b99260053ab9897c921c93b5

added_lines: def test_allocate_for_instance_with_queues(self): requested_networks = objects.NetworkRequestList( objects=[objects.NetworkRequest(network_id=self.nets2[0]['id'], queues=4), objects.NetworkRequest(network_id=self.nets2[1]['id'], queues=8)]) self._returned_nw_info = [model.VIF(**self.port_data1[0]), model.VIF(**self.port_data2[0])] port1 = {'port': {'id': 'my_portid1'}} port2 = {'port': {'id': 'my_portid2'}} port_ids = [port1, port2] vifs = self._allocate_for_instance(net_idx=2, requested_networks=requested_networks, port_ids=port_ids) self.assertEqual(4, vifs[0]['meta'].get('queues')) self.assertEqual(8, vifs[1]['meta'].get('queues')) requested_networks = objects.NetworkRequestList( objects=[objects.NetworkRequest(network_id=self.nets1[0]['id'])]) self._returned_nw_info = [model.VIF(**self.port_data1[0]), model.VIF(**self.port_data2[0])] new_port = {'port': {'id': 'my_portid1'}} port_ids = [new_port] nw_info = self._allocate_for_instance(net_idx=1, requested_networks=requested_networks, port_ids=port_ids) self.assertEqual(nw_info[0]['id'], new_port['port']['id'])
deleted_lines: new_port = {'id': 'fake'} self._returned_nw_info = self.port_data1 + [new_port] nw_info = self._allocate_for_instance() self.assertEqual(nw_info, [new_port])

commit_message:
Filter snapshots data on the DB side

It filters snapshots data on the DB side to improve performance. 
Some tests are removed from test_snapshots.py because their function
implemented on the DB side.

Partial-Implements: blueprint data-filtering-on-the-db-side
Change-Id: I1c3e47a4f3780de54d7a5920f463e26cc8b7bcc2

commit_message:
Apply a naming rule of GET to compute clients(v*)

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to compute clients which names are "v*".

In addition, this patch removes unnecessary str() because
all callers specify string values and we need to pass py3
tests when migrating them into tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I17b62791b287bb7150603a029049278756a8616d

If the permissions aren't quoted, libvirtd won't start.

Change-Id: I3af01420eda0e8461cd71421c3422f8b626b5e1f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix quoting for unix_sock_rw_perms

If the permissions aren't quoted, libvirtd won't start.
(At least, that's the case on my CentOS 7.1 install.)

Change-Id: I3af01420eda0e8461cd71421c3422f8b626b5e1f

commit_message:
Validate LP name before creation

Just some quick sanity checking in the LP controller datamodel.

This review also extends image.base_image_id to 100 characters,
the same size as image.name, as the former can be either a name or
a uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1430469
Closes-Bug: #1451483
Change-Id: Ie27d75d6c167a277fe3cc09fb8dce7e27c2f793c

commit_message:
Apply a naming rule of GET to compute clients(t*)

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to compute clients which names are "t*".

In addition, this patch removes unnecessary str() because
all callers specify string values and we need to pass py3
tests when migrating them into tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I9d7787d50f616e74ccbc06388813fc7fcb994dea

commit_message:
Use right oslo.service entry points

Use oslo.service.sslutils and periodic_task entry points to generate
a sample configuration file. oslo.service library doesn't have
an oslo.service entry point.

Change-Id: I240afb39c043fdeb39c7807bdf086927186ab881
Closes-Bug: 1468955

commit_message:
Improve fixture usage.

There were two broad issues with fixtures.

Firstly, the 'SafeFixture' workaround for resource leaks in fixtures
<1.3 is not needed if we depend on fixtures>=1.3.1. While testtools
may raise a TypeError when trying to query a fixture that failed to
setup, this is only ever a cascading failure - it will not cause
tests to fail, cause leaks, or cause tests to incorrectly pass. That
will be fixed in testtools soon to stop it happening (but as it cannot
affect whether a test passes or fails or leaks happen there is no
reason to wait for that). Leaks are seen with fixtures 1.3.0 still
because eventlet raises a BaseException subclass rather than an
Exception subclass, and fixtures 1.3.0 didn't handle that - 1.3.1 does.

Secondly, some of the fixtures had race conditions where things were
started and then cleanups scheduled. Where possible I've fixed those,
but some of them require more significant work to fully address.

Change-Id: I3290712f7274970defda19263f4955e3c78e5ed6
Depends-On: I8c01506894ec0a92b53bc0e4ad14767f2dd6a6b3
Closes-bug: #1453888

commit_message:
Modify RemoteClient to use ssh validation config parameters

This patch implements changes needed to remove the usage of
deprecated tempest ssh configuration parameters and replace it
with the parameters set by ssh auth strategy blueprint

Partially implements: blueprint ssh-auth-strategy

Change-Id: I558a04b0bb61ecf8e428a0f682fbb42a67695318

gate-oslo.db-tox-mysql-python should not run in stable branches

We should run this job only in master as it was recently added
and needs changes present only in master.

revisions:

Change-Id: Ic2762814ab0522820386ed830a1b13fbce50a380

commit_message:
Add support for delete port

This patch introduce port deletion including all the
configured L2 flows

Change-Id: Ic2762814ab0522820386ed830a1b13fbce50a380
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/22/197922/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.ports = {} # TODO(gsagie) refactor this method for smaller methods ports_to_remove = set(self.ports.keys()) port = self._create_port_dict(logical_port, mac_address, network, ofport, tunnel_key, True) self.ports[logical_port] = port if logical_port in ports_to_remove: ports_to_remove.remove(logical_port) port = self._create_port_dict(logical_port, mac_address, network, ofport, tunnel_key, False) self.ports[logical_port] = port if logical_port in ports_to_remove: ports_to_remove.remove(logical_port) # TODO(gsagie) use port dictionary in all methods in l2 app # and here instead of always moving all arguments for port_to_remove in ports_to_remove: p = self.ports[port_to_remove] if p['is_local']: self.l2_app.remove_local_port(p['lport_id'], p['mac'], p['network_id'], p['ofport'], p['tunnel_key']) del self.ports[port_to_remove] else: self.l2_app.remove_remote_port(p['lport_id'], p['mac'], p['network_id'], p['tunnel_key']) del self.ports[port_to_remove] def _create_port_dict(self, lport_id, mac, network_id, ofport, tunnel_key, is_local): port = {'lport_id': lport_id, 'mac': mac, 'network_id': network_id, 'ofport': ofport, 'tunnel_key': tunnel_key, 'is_local': is_local} return port

subject: Treat bug/ and feature/ branches the same way
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-25 20:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['test-matrix.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/cf0cb2f98da970655ca0b80141a37a3b2b3f3eef', 'message': 'Treat bug/ and feature/ branches the same way

Add support for bug/ branches for projects that use intermediate
releases to support the case where a change has landed in master and a
bug fix is needed, but the branch to be created should not be seen as a
long term stable release series. For example, if a breaking change is
made in a library in anticipation of a major series version update, but
then a critical bug is found in the previous intermediate release. The
fix could be back-ported and released into the master stream without the
breaking change.

Change-Id: Ic790600c4c058817e32422f7c7d1be7fdbf98994
'}]
commit_message:
Treat bug/ and feature/ branches the same way

Add support for bug/ branches for projects that use intermediate
releases to support the case where a change has landed in master and a
bug fix is needed, but the branch to be created should not be seen as a
long term stable release series. For example, if a breaking change is
made in a library in anticipation of a major series version update, but
then a critical bug is found in the previous intermediate release. The
fix could be back-ported and released into the master stream without the
breaking change.

Change-Id: Ic790600c4c058817e32422f7c7d1be7fdbf98994
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/24/195724/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if branch.startswith(("feature/", "bug/")): # Feature and bug branches chase master and should be tested
deleted_lines: if branch.startswith("feature/"): # Feature branches chase master and should be tested

commit_message:
Add ability to filter nodes by provision_state via API

In standalone case using "associated" filter no longer makes sense.
also, it might be useful to filter nodes for different states

Change-Id: Ifcd554de04cdc42bffea1a116307b045f39c8416
Closes-Bug: #1468229

commit_message:
Add common function for v2.1 API flavor_get.

There are objects.Flaovr.get_by_flavor_id function in API layer
we need to catch FlavorNotFound every time. This patch make a
common function and catch FlavorNotFound in V2.1 API

Change-Id: I900debd2e096405ab91f7eb041359c2830c03c2d

deleted_lines: try: flavor = objects.Flavor.get_by_flavor_id(context, flavor_id) except exception.FlavorNotFound as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=e.format_message())

commit_message:
collector: fix test raising error

We are using _raise_error to raise an error, but it has the wrong
prototype. So currently the test work because of that, but that's not
really clean.

Change-Id: I5bb379172edc9cde1a852214231da6766acebf81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/37/197637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _raise_error(*args, **kwargs):

subject: Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-25 10:09:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/3ac0039285f54e24cdb83871805c59d368f12cb5', 'message': 'Adjust glance_api_servers var to point to LB

Initial this var pointed to each individual glance api server in a list.
This causes nova and cinder to fail when glance servers are down.
Changing this to the LB VIP works as intended.

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59
Closes-Bug: #1461245
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-30 12:42:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/8faa7c2c13567283dc7ba82459003ca229ab5a65', 'message': 'Remove glance_api_servers in favour of host/port

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59
Closes-Bug: #1461245
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-30 13:25:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/7f41e2025bec379e1939cf8d163cf03e9e8135d3', 'message': 'Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

glance_api_servers is still available and if specified will be used in
favour of host/port, but default it is commented out and the host/port
will be used - which uses the internal_lb_vip_address and default
glance_api_service_port.

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59
Closes-Bug: #1461245
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-01 10:17:21.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_group_vars.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/d8b4cf9e790f812b2cfafb237d5909e46c3744d9', 'message': 'Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

glance_api_servers is still available and if specified will be used in
favour of host/port, but default it is commented out and the host/port
will be used - which uses the internal_lb_vip_address and default

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59

commit_message:
Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

glance_api_servers is still available and if specified will be used in
favour of host/port, but default it is commented out and the host/port
will be used - which uses the internal_lb_vip_address and default
glance_api_service_port.

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59
Closes-Bug: #1461245
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/96/195496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: glance_api_servers: "{% for host in groups['glance_all'] %}{{ hostvars[host]['container_address'] }}:{{ glance_service_port }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}"

commit_message:
Get rid of dependencies on fixed networks' names

We cannot rely on names of networks anymore as netorking with templates
will allow to create/delete networks and set (almost) arbitrary names
to them. So, we need to tie services for network roles.
While network roles descriptions are in development we can use hardcoded
version where network roles are in plain list and network roles to networks
mapping is fixed.

Change-Id: Ibf523885faa57bb2435f9bf6386258b69063b318
Implements: blueprint templates-for-networking

commit_message:
Updated tempest isolation options

This change updates the way that the packages are installed in an
isolated deployment. This ensures that our build packages are used
within the deployment while also allowing temptest to go online and
consume upstream packages from pypi.

Change-Id: Ia479610b9ab69d64d1de756099d840b2ab331378
Closes-Bug: #1466010
(cherry picked commit from 2086f6edb1a4c50dc0000804a510aa4da1af4f5f)

commit_message:
Separate rpm specs for V2 and V3 added

Add rpm spec for 3.0.0 version that allows includes in rpm
pre-/post-/uninstall hooks. Directory tree modified: separate rpm spec
files must be contained by repo. Version mapping changed to provide new
template path to builders. Tests updated.

DocImpact: Describe spec scripts in Fuel Plugin wiki

Change-Id: I3810a33d13a89ce7145091e85295821fec3e9ba9
Implements: blueprint role-as-a-plugin
Closes-Bug: #1462976

commit_message:
IBP: disable HTTP pipelining for apt

Under certain circumstances HTTP pipelining, which is turned on by default for
apt, could cause slow down of HTTP connection.

As HTTP pipelining is mainly useful for high latency channels such as satellite
Internel connections, there's no apparent speed up for broadband connections.
Moreover, the majority of modern web browsers doesn't enable it by default due
to concerns regarding a large amount of buggy proxies/servers/middleboxes.

So, it could be safely turned off as it brings more harm than good.

Change-Id: Idf1e2f82f2a51080f959e80fe58672c50c4d9772
Closes-Bug: #1470468
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/03/197603/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def make_ubuntu_apt_disable_http_pipelining(uids): config_content = 'Acquire::http::Pipeline-Depth "0";\n'\ 'Acquire::http::No-Cache "true";\n' config_path = '/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/06disable-http-pipelining' return make_upload_task(uids, config_content, config_path)

commit_message:
Add documentation guidance

This update provides initial guidance covering the content of the API
reference documentation for a product as well as practices to ensure
the implementation accurately reflects behavior specified in the API
reference.

Change-Id: I26c9cff8c9f2567fa7e08704bc43bcb5fc0185f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/26/131726/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The general principle for API development can be stated as follows. Review requests which affect the public (HTTP) API of a product should be supported by the reference API documentation prior to merging the new code. Public API ~~~~~~~~~~ The public API of a product consists of all aspects of the HTTP request and response which extend beyond the information stated in RFC 2616. This includes, but is not limited to the following: * Optional and/or custom HTTP headers which appear in the request. * Optional and/or custom HTTP headers which appear in the response. * Query parameters which are recognized by the service. * The complete structure of a JSON object appearing in the request or response. This includes the names of properties and both the structure and semantics of property values. * **TODO**: For APIs which support non-JSON representations, similar documentation should appear which is meaningful in the context of that representation. Supporting Documentation ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Supporting documentation consists of information clearly exposed through the API reference material for the product. Specifically, this in the product's equivalent of the information published in the `OpenStack API Complete Reference <http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref.html>`_. The supporting documentation requirement for review requests that affect the public API of a product may include both changes already published in the API reference and changes which have already been submitted for review. If a documentation change has been submitted for review but not yet accepted, the review request to change the implementation should include a comment with a link to the proposed documentation change. The following are examples of several ways documentation for a product may be provided. * In general, documentation for any aspect of the public API should appear in the documentation for every HTTP API call to which the aspect applies. * Documentation for aspects which apply to all, or nearly all, calls in the API may appear as high-level documentation separate from the documentation of individual calls. In cases where this general documentation has known exceptions for specific API calls, the wording of the general documentation should include wording such as "Except where otherwise stated..." to indicate the presence of exceptions within specific calls. A user familiar with using HTTP requests in an application should be able to understand the complete semantics of any API call in the product by reading nothing more than the general documentation for the product followed by the documentation listed for the specific call. The following are examples of documentation which is not considered part of the API reference for a product. * External documentation, unless a direct hyperlink to the published form of the external documentation appears within the API reference. Examples of external documentation include comments within the implementation code, blueprints, commit messages, wiki pages, and documentation files in any format published independently of the API reference material for the product.

commit_message:
Adds clarifaction on when to use 409

What to do when a user requests a process which is already
underway and cannot be run twice concurrently.

Related patch: I88bced1e6009634a64d59a2050452ecf0eb4cfab

Change-Id: Id7fd4636af4f3db39cf99bb52b4955e4445edc5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/86/179386/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * If a call is made which attempts to put a resource into a state which it is already in (eg locking an instance which is already locked), the return code should be **200 OK**. * If a call is made which attempts to perform an action on a server which is already performing that action and therefore the request cannot be fulfilled (eg snapshotting an instance which is already in the process of snapshotting), the return code should be **409 Conflict**.

commit_message:
Remove puppet-network manifest

Fuel uses masterless puppet. This manifest is not required
anymore.

Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Adds clarifications on state-conflicting requests

How to respond when the user requests a state which is already
satisfied.
